intro: Dendrobium chameleon var. ovatilabium, commonly known as the rainbow orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to Southeast Asia. It features vibrant, colorful flowers that change hues depending on light and environmental conditions, giving it its common name. The plant has a sympodial growth habit, with pseudobulbs that store water and nutrients. Its leaves are usually elliptical and革质 (leathery), adapting to its natural habitat. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil for optimal growth.
